title: Argentina’s Economic Misery Could Bring Populism Back to the Country
summary: Argentina’s turn away from populism and embrace of market forces has enraged people who have lost aid without producing a promised economic revival.

title: The Fusion Reactor Next Door
summary: Entrepreneurs are taking up the search for a near limitless energy source and seeking investors willing to put money behind a long-shot bet against climate change.

title: Modi Promised Better Days and Bridges. India’s Voters Are Still Waiting.
summary: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeks re-election, he confronts anger over a weakening economy and failed promises to revive stalled infrastructure projects.

title: The Week in Business: A Facial Recognition Ban, and Trade War Blues
summary: Also: Worries about another war, and the continuing crisis at Boeing.

title: Stocks Slide Over Worsening U.S.-China Trade Tensions
summary: Investors seemed to be reacting to a growing sense that the dispute between Washington and Beijing was deepening and would continue indefinitely.

title: China’s Supply of Minerals for iPhones and Missiles Could Be a Risky Trade Weapon
summary: The country dominates production of the rare earths used in myriad technologies, but tangled global supply chains make it hard to hit the U.S. directly.

title: Things Were Going Great for Wall Street. Then the Trade War Heated Up.
summary: Stocks fell more than 6 percent in May, as threats to the global economy seemed to proliferate by the week, with tariffs rising and talks yielding no meaningful results.

title: As Trade War Spreads to Mexico, Companies Lose a Safe Harbor
summary: Trade tensions led American companies to shift operations to Mexico from China. President Trump’s latest tariff threat has upended that strategy.

title: A Slower Economy. A Trade War. Now, China Faces Rising Food Prices.
summary: Pork and fruit are costing more even as Beijing reassures the public that supplies are plentiful.

title: Stocks Jump as Fed’s Powell Suggests Rates Could Come Down
summary: Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chairman, said the central bank was “closely monitoring” trade and “as always, we will act as appropriate” to sustain the expansion.

title: Putin Aims to Revive the Economy With a Plan. And Pianos.
summary: As Russian officials unveil a spending plan aimed at doubling growth in its troubled economy, critics see a $400 billion effort in Soviet-era planning.

title: Another Sign of Economic Worry: Tumbling Oil Prices
summary: Prices have dropped more than 20 percent since late April as investors worry that growth is slowing and trade disputes could slow growth further.

title: A Weak Jobs Report Poses a New Challenge to Trump: A Slowing Economy
summary: A sharp decline in the pace of hiring in May, especially in sectors dependent on trade, suggests that the president’s tariffs are starting to bite.

title: Putin and Xi Herald the Virtues of Globalism, Critiquing the U.S. on Trade
summary: The presidents of Russia and China used an investment conference to critique what they saw as increased protectionism by the United States amid rising tensions.

title: The Week in Business: YouTube Flip-Flops on Hate Speech
summary: Plus, why the auto industry doesn’t want Trump to loosen emissions standards.

title: A New Revolution? Mexico Still Waiting as López Obrador Nears Half-Year Mark
summary: The new country President Andrés Manuel López Obrador says he is building looks an awful lot like the old one he swore to leave behind in the campaign.

title: Claim of Attacks on 4 Oil Vessels Raises Tensions in Middle East
summary: Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and a private company said four ships were struck as the United States ordered forces to the region to counter Iran. But officials did not say who was to blame.

title: In North Korea, Worst Drought in Decades Adds to Food Crisis
summary: North Korea says it has received just 2.1 inches of rain this year, and the United Nations warned of a food crisis barring urgent outside aid.

title: U.S. Suspends Passenger and Cargo Flights to Venezuela
summary: The Department of Homeland Security said the country’s instability created conditions that “threaten the safety and security of passengers, aircraft, and crew.”

title: China Arrests 2 Canadians on Spying Charges, Deepening a Political Standoff
summary: Supporters of the two men, who were detained in December, say the case amounts to retaliation for the arrest in Vancouver of a Chinese tech executive.

title: Iran Crisis or ‘Circus’? A Weary Middle East Wonders
summary: A sudden profusion of incidents and warnings has stirred fears that the Trump administration is trying to gin up a flawed case for war, like the Bush administration did in Iraq in 2003.

title: Israel Presses the Case Against Iran, but Not for War
summary: Israel has quietly played an instrumental role in the escalating tensions in the Middle East. But analysts say it wants to pressure Iran, not start a war.

title: Colombia’s Peace Deal Promised a New Era. So Why Are These Rebels Rearming?
summary: Rebels are rearming, violence is soaring in the countryside and a new government is wavering in its commitment.

title: Venezuela’s Collapse Is the Worst Outside of War in Decades, Economists Say
summary: Butchers have stopped selling meat cuts in favor of offal, fat shavings and cow hooves, the only animal protein many of their customers can afford.

title: Saudi Oil Infrastructure at Risk as Small Attacks Raise Potential for Big Disruption
summary: Saudi Arabia spent heavily to protect its oil production lines, but rapid changes in technology may mean ports and pipelines are increasingly exposed in the turbulent region.

title: U.S. Officials Work to Convince Divided Congress of Iran Threat
summary: American officials said Iran had threatened to target missiles at Saudi Arabia’s oil infrastructure to drive up oil prices and disrupt international trade.

title: Iran Stiffens Its Resolve as the Trump Administration’s Pressure Mounts
summary: Increasing pressure has taken a toll on Iran, but if the goal was to change its behavior or its government, it has so far achieved neither.

title: 100 Killed in Sudan and Dozens of Bodies Are Pulled From Nile, Opposition Says
summary: A doctors’ group that has helped organize pro-democracy protests in Sudan said hundreds of others were injured in a crackdown by security forces.

title: Xi Jinping’s Visit to Russia Accents Ties in Face of Tensions with U.S.
summary: Russia’s relations with China have improved gradually since 2014, when President Vladimir V. Putin announced a pivot to Asia after the Crimea crisis.
